definition: old variant of 趁[chen4]
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
to strike while the iron is hot
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to take the opportunity/in passing
variant of 稱錢|称钱[chen4 qian2]
variant of 稱心|称心[chen4 xin1]
to run away in the confusion/to take advantage of the confusion to escape
to take advantage of sb's difficulties (idiom)
erhua variant of 趁早[chen4 zao3]

sentences.english: He was interviewed during his visit to Japan this week.
sentences.chinese: 是趁著前两天金范来日时，额外作的访谈。

sentences.english: Well, you're only younger once-there's plenty of time for that later.
sentences.chinese: 还是趁年轻尽情享受吧，以后有的是时间工作。

sentences.english: The building which stands near the train station is a supermarket.
sentences.chinese: 位于火趁魅站四周的那座年夜楼是一家超市。

sentences.english: Lester was gone, and I brushed the powder away before anyone could see it.
sentences.chinese: 莱斯特跑了，而我趁还没人看见，扫掉了粉末。

sentences.english: Live, pluck the roses of the world to-day.
sentences.chinese: 生活吧，趁今朝赶紧采下那世俗的玫瑰。

sentences.english: Let's sing a song during the break.
sentences.chinese: 我们趁这空当儿唱支歌。

sentences.english: The machine SuoYi while help nursing switched two girls.
sentences.chinese: 索宜趁帮助喂奶之机互换了两个女婴。

sentences.english: Professor, run away now while they are paying attention to you.
sentences.chinese: 教授，趁他们不注意，你快逃吧。

sentences.english: Not being seen by anyone, the thief escaped.
sentences.chinese: 那个贼趁无人看见时逃跑了。

sentences.english: He sticked provocative poster on board when nobody was looking.
sentences.chinese: 趁无人注意，他在板上贴了具有煽动性的海报。

sentences.english: It must therefore be stored as fresh food.
sentences.chinese: 因此，食物应趁其新鲜时就加以储存。

sentences.english: You'd better do more reading while you are young.
sentences.chinese: 你最好趁年轻多读点书。

sentences.english: In the pause he managed to insert a question.
sentences.chinese: 趁说话停顿时他提了一个问题。

sentences.english: Anne held a hen party at her home when her parent had gone abroad.
sentences.chinese: 安妮趁她父母出国时，在家里举办母鸡宴会。

sentences.english: 'Cause he is worrying about his wife would taking nude pictures while he's away.
sentences.chinese: 因为他害怕他布吕尼趁他不在又去拍裸照。
为学趁年青，既学须学好。

definition: to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
unprepared/off guard
to wait for an opportunity/to watch for one's chance
just (in time)/just right/just enough/to happen to/to chance to/by chance/it just so happens that
stealthily/secretly/covertly/furtively/on the sly
to seize the opportunity
thoughtless/not pay attention to
to leave in stealth/to slip away
to look for an opportunity
quietly/secretly/stealthily/quiet/worried/Taiwan pr. [qiao3 qiao3]
gap (between two objects)/interval of time (between events)/opening in one's schedule/free time/(fig.) gap (in the market etc)
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
who would have thought/unexpectedly
to steal away/to beat it
now/this moment
to pretend/to pose as
